name: Push up
written_instructions:
1. Start in a high plank position with your hands flat on the floor, slightly wider than shoulder-width, and your body in a straight line from head to heels.
2. Engage your core and keep your neck neutral.
3. Bend your elbows at a slight angle (not fully to the sides) and lower your chest toward the floor in a controlled motion.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your form consistent.
audio_script: Start in a high plank with your hands a little wider than your shoulders and your body straight from head to heels. Keep your core tight and your neck neutral. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the floor, then press back up to the start. Repeat with control.

name: Close grip push up
written_instructions:
1. Start in a high plank position with your hands placed directly under your shoulders or slightly closer together.
2. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, core engaged.
3. Bend your elbows close to your body as you lower your chest toward the floor in a controlled motion.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining elbows close throughout.
audio_script: Start in a high plank with your hands under your shoulders or slightly closer together. Keep your body straight and core engaged. Lower your chest by bending your elbows close to your sides, then press back up to the start. Keep your elbows tucked in as you repeat.

name: Loop band push up
written_instructions:
1. Place a loop resistance band around your upper back and secure the ends under your palms on the floor.
2. Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width and your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Engage your core and keep your neck neutral.
4. Bend your elbows at a slight angle (not fully to the sides) and lower your chest toward the floor in a controlled motion.
5. Press through your palms against the band’s resistance to return to the starting position, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Place a loop band across your upper back and pin the ends under your palms. Get into a high plank with your hands wider than your shoulders and body straight. Keep your core tight, lower your chest toward the floor, then press back up against the band’s resistance. Repeat.

name: Deficit push up
written_instructions:
1. Place two sturdy, equal-height platforms (such as weight plates or push-up handles) slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Start in a high plank position with each hand on a platform, body in a straight line from head to heels, and core engaged.
3. Bend your elbows at a slight angle (not fully to the sides) and lower your chest between the platforms in a controlled motion for a deeper range of motion.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining full control throughout.
audio_script: Place your hands on two sturdy platforms, slightly wider than shoulder-width. Start in a high plank with your body straight and core engaged. Lower your chest between the platforms for a deeper range of motion, then press back up to the start. Repeat with control.

name: Dumbbell pullover
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor and a dumbbell held with both hands above your chest.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and engage your core.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbell in an arc over and behind your head until you feel a stretch in your chest and lats.
4. Pull the dumbbell back over your chest by engaging your chest and back muscles.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining control of the weight throughout.
audio_script: Lie on a flat bench with your feet on the floor, holding a dumbbell above your chest. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and your core engaged. Lower the dumbbell back in an arc over your head until you feel a stretch, then pull it back above your chest. Repeat with control.

name: Band pullover
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a resistance band with handles to a sturdy point behind your head while lying on the floor (e.g., the base of a heavy piece of equipment).
2. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and arms extended straight overhead holding the handles.
3. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and engage your core.
4. Pull the handles in an arc until your arms are directly above your chest, squeezing your chest and lats.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position overhead in a controlled motion, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie on your back with your knees bent and a resistance band anchored behind you. Hold the handles overhead with your arms straight and a slight bend in the elbows. Keep your core tight, pull the handles forward in an arc until they’re above your chest, then slowly return overhead. Repeat.

name: Handle band pullover
written_instructions:
1. Anchor a resistance band with handles to a sturdy point behind your head while lying on the floor (e.g., the base of a heavy piece of equipment or a door anchor).
2. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and arms extended straight overhead holding the handles.
3. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and engage your core.
4. Pull the handles in an arc until your arms are directly above your chest, squeezing your chest and lats.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position overhead in a controlled motion, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie on your back with your knees bent and a resistance band anchored behind you. Hold the handles overhead with your arms straight and a slight bend in the elbows. Keep your core tight, pull the handles forward in an arc until they’re above your chest, then slowly return overhead. Repeat.

name: Machine dips
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the dip machine and adjust the seat height so the handles are level with your lower chest or slightly below.
2. Grasp the handles with a firm grip and position your feet flat on the floor or on the provided footrests.
3. Lean your torso slightly forward while keeping your shoulders down and elbows pointing back.
4. Press the handles downward by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straightened.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position in a controlled motion, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit on the dip machine with the handles at lower chest level. Grip the handles and place your feet on the floor or footrests. Lean forward slightly, keeping your shoulders down. Press the handles down until your arms are straight, then return slowly to the start. Repeat.

name: Dips
written_instructions:
1. Grasp the parallel bars with your palms facing inward and arms straight, supporting your body above the bars.
2. Cross your ankles behind you or keep your legs straight, and lean your torso slightly forward while keeping your shoulders down and elbows pointing back.
3. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
4. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining control throughout the movement.
audio_script: Hold the parallel bars with your arms straight to support your body. Cross your ankles or keep your legs straight and lean forward slightly. Lower until your arms are about parallel to the floor, then press back up to the start. Repeat with control.

name: Weighted dips
written_instructions:
1. Secure a dip belt around your waist and attach a weight plate or dumbbell to the chain so it hangs between your legs.
2. Grasp the parallel bars with your palms facing inward and arms straight, supporting your body above the bars.
3. Cross your ankles behind you or keep your legs straight, and lean your torso slightly forward while keeping your shoulders down and elbows pointing back.
4. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
5. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Strap on a dip belt with weight hanging between your legs. Hold the bars with your arms straight and lean forward slightly. Lower until your arms are about parallel to the floor, then press back up to the start. Repeat under control.

name: Barbell floor press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, holding a barbell with both hands above your chest.
2. Position your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width and keep your wrists straight.
3. Lower the barbell in a controlled motion until your upper arms touch the floor, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
4. Press the barbell upward until your arms are fully extended over your chest.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining control of the weight throughout.
audio_script: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, holding a barbell above your chest. Lower the bar until your upper arms touch the floor, keeping your elbows at a slight angle. Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended. Repeat.

name: Barbell bench press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor and your eyes directly under the barbell.
2. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width, keeping your wrists straight.
3. Unrack the bar and hold it above your chest with arms fully extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to touch the middle of your chest, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended over your chest, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie on a flat bench with your feet on the floor and your eyes under the bar. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width and unrack it, holding it above your chest. Lower the bar in control to the middle of your chest, keeping elbows at a slight angle. Press it back up to full extension, then repeat.

name: Barbell larsen press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your legs extended straight out and feet hovering off the floor.
2. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width and unrack it, holding it above your chest with arms fully extended.
3. Keep your core tight and lower back pressed into the bench to maintain stability.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to touch the middle of your chest, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended over your chest, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: ie on a flat bench with your legs straight and feet off the floor. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width and unrack it above your chest. Keep your core tight and back pressed into the bench. Lower the bar to your chest with elbows at a slight angle, then press back up to full extension. Repeat.

name: Incline barbell bench press
written_instructions:
1. Set an adjustable bench to a 30–45° incline and lie back with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width, keeping your wrists straight.
3. Unrack the bar and hold it above your upper chest with arms fully extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to touch your upper chest, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Set a bench to a 30 to 45 degree incline and lie back with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width and unrack it above your upper chest. Lower the bar in control to your upper chest, elbows at a slight angle, then press it back up to full extension. Repeat.

name: Decline barbell bench press
written_instructions:
1. Set a decline bench to the desired angle and secure your feet under the footpads.
2. Lie back on the bench with your eyes under the bar and grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
3. Unrack the bar and hold it above your lower chest with arms fully extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to lightly touch your lower chest or upper abdomen, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Set a decline bench and secure your feet under the footpads. Lie back with your eyes under the bar and grip it slightly wider than shoulder-width. Unrack the bar and hold it above your lower chest. Lower it in control to your lower chest or upper abdomen, elbows at a slight angle. Press it back up to full extension, then repeat.

name: Close-grip bench press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor and your eyes under the bar.
2. Grip the bar with your hands about shoulder-width apart or slightly closer, keeping your wrists straight.
3. Unrack the bar and hold it above your chest with arms fully extended.
4. Lower the bar in a controlled motion to touch the middle of your chest, keeping your elbows close to your torso.
5. Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat and eyes under the bar. Grip the bar about shoulder-width apart or slightly closer. Unrack the bar and hold it above your chest with arms extended. Lower it under control to your mid chest, keeping elbows close to your torso. Press it back up to full extension, then repeat.

name: Dumbell bench press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing forward.
2. Keep your wrists straight and a slight bend in your elbows.
3. Lower the dumbbells in a controlled motion to chest level, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
4. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended over your chest.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining control throughout the movement.
audio_script: Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest, palms facing forward. Keep your wrists straight and a slight bend in your elbows. Lower the dumbbells in a controlled motion to chest level, keeping your elbows at a slight angle. Press the dumbbells back up until your arms are fully extended over your chest, then repeat.

name: Incline dumbbell press
written_instructions:
1. Set an adjustable bench to a 30–45° incline and sit back with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your upper chest with palms facing forward and arms fully extended.
3. Keep your wrists straight and a slight bend in your elbows.
4. Lower the dumbbells in a controlled motion to chest level, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
5. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired number of reps.

Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your upper chest with palms facing forward and arms fully extended. Keep your wrists straight and a slight bend in your elbows. name: Decline dumbbell press
written_instructions:
1. Set a decline bench to the desired angle and secure your feet under the footpads.
2. Lie back with a dumbbell in each hand above your lower chest, palms facing forward, and arms fully extended.
3. Keep your wrists straight and a slight bend in your elbows.
4. Lower the dumbbells in a controlled motion to chest level, keeping your elbows at a slight angle (not flared fully to the sides).
5. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended, then repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: Dumbbell squeeze press
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest.
2. Press the dumbbells together so they stay in contact throughout the movement, palms facing each other.
3. Lower the dumbbells in a controlled motion to your chest while maintaining constant inward pressure.
4. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended, keeping the dumbbells squeezed together.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining steady pressure throughout the exercise.
audio_script: Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest. Press them back up until your arms are fully extended, keeping the dumbbells squeezed together. Repeat for the desired number of reps, maintaining steady pressure throughout.

name: Incline dumbell squeeze press
written_instructions:
1. Set an adjustable bench to a 30–45° incline and sit back with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your upper chest.

name: Cable flyes
written_instructions:
1. Set the pulleys on a cable machine to chest height and attach D-handles.
2. Stand in the middle, grab the handles, and take a small step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with your arms extended out to the sides, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing each other.
4. Bring the handles together in front of your chest in a wide arc, squeezing your chest at the midpoint.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position in a controlled motion, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Set the pulleys on a cable machine to chest height and attach the handles. Stand in the middle, grab the handles, and step forward into a staggered stance for balance. Start with your arms out to the sides, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing each other. Bring the handles together in front of your chest in a wide arc, squeezing your chest at the midpoint. name: Banded chest flyes
variations: Single loop band low-to-high cable flyes
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each loop band and anchor both bands to sturdy points behind you at chest height, set wider than shoulder width so the bands stay clear of your arms.
2. Hold one handle in each hand and step forward into a staggered stance for balance.
3. Start with your arms extended out to the sides, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing each other.
4. Pull the handles together in a wide arc until they meet in front of your chest, squeezing your chest muscles at the midpoint.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired number of reps.

4. Press the handles straight forward until your arms are fully extended without locking your elbows.
5. Slowly return the handles back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the chest press machine with your back against the pad and feet flat. Adjust the seat so the handles are at chest level. Grip the handles with elbows bent. Press them straight forward until your arms are extended, then return slowly to the start. Repeat.

name: Floor dumbbell fly
written_instructions:
1. Lie flat on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other and elbows slightly bent.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until your upper arms lightly touch the floor.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together above your chest, maintaining the slight bend in your elbows.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, keeping the motion slow and controlled.
audio_script: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your chest, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms touch the floor, then bring them back together above your chest. Repeat with control.

name: Dumbbell fly
written_instructions:
1. Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other and elbows slightly bent.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until they are at chest level or slightly below, keeping the slight bend in your elbows.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together above your chest in the same wide arc, squeezing your chest muscles at the top.
5. Repeat for the desired reps with slow, controlled motion.
audio_script: Lie on a flat bench with your feet on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your chest, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells out wide to chest level, then bring them back together above your chest and squeeze. Repeat with control.

name: Incline dumbbell fly
written_instructions:
1. Set a bench to a 30–45° incline and lie back with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your upper chest with palms facing each other and elbows slightly bent.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until they are level with your chest or shoulders, keeping the slight bend in your elbows.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together above your upper chest in the same wide arc, squeezing your chest muscles at the top.
5. Repeat for the desired reps with slow, controlled motion.
audio_script: Lie on an incline bench with your feet on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand above your upper chest, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells out wide to chest level, then bring them back together above your chest and squeeze. Repeat with control.

name: Standing dumbbell lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and your core engaged.
3. Raise both dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, keeping palms facing downward and elbows leading the movement.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to your sides under control.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, avoiding swinging or shrugging your shoulders.
audio_script: Stand with feet hip-width apart and dumbbells at your sides. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise the dumbbells out to shoulder height with palms down. Lower slowly to your sides and repeat.

name: Banded lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward band lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of a loop band and place the middle of the band under one foot in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward, elbows slightly bent, and core engaged.
3. Raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, leading with your elbows and keeping palms facing downward.
4. Slowly lower the handles back to your sides under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your torso still and avoiding swinging.
audio_script: Stand in a staggered stance with one foot on the band and a handle in each hand at your sides. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise the handles out to shoulder height with palms down. Lower slowly to your sides and repeat.

name: Handle band lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward Handle band lateral raise
bent over Handle band lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand in the middle of a handled resistance band with your feet hip-width apart or in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward, elbows slightly bent, and core braced.
3. Raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, leading with your elbows and keeping palms facing downward.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to your sides under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your torso still and avoiding swinging or shrugging.
audio_script: Stand on the middle of a handled band with a handle in each hand at your sides. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise the handles out to shoulder height with palms down. Lower slowly to your sides and repeat.

name: Bent over dumbbell lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at arm’s length with palms facing each other.
2. Hinge forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. Let the dumbbells hang below your shoulders with elbows slightly bent.
4. Raise both dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, squeezing your rear delts at the top.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hinge forward at the hips until your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing each other. With elbows slightly bent, raise the dumbbells out to shoulder height, then lower them slowly. Repeat.

name: Bent over band lateral raise
prerequisite_exercise: Standing leaning forward band lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward band lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and place the middle of the band under one foot in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other and hinge forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
3. Let the handles hang below your shoulders with elbows slightly bent.
4. Raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, squeezing your rear delts at the top.
5. Slowly lower the handles back down under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand in a staggered stance with the band under one foot and hinge forward until your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other. With elbows bent, raise the handles out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Bent over Handle band lateral raise
prerequisite_exercise: Standing leaning forward Handle band lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward Handle band lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand on the middle of a handled resistance band with your feet hip-width apart or in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other and hinge forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. Let the handles hang below your shoulders with elbows slightly bent.
4. Raise both handles out to the sides until they reach shoulder height, squeezing your rear delts at the top.
5. Slowly lower the handles back down under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand on the middle of a handled band and hinge forward until your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing each other. With elbows bent, raise the handles out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Standing full ROM lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and raise the dumbbells out to the sides in an arc, continuing past shoulder height until they meet overhead.
3. At the top, your arms should be almost straight with the backs of your palms facing each other.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells along the same path back to your sides under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or leaning back.
audio_script: Stand with dumbbells at your sides and a slight bend in your elbows. Raise them out to the sides and keep going until the dumbbells meet overhead, with the backs of your palms facing each other. Lower slowly to your sides and repeat.

name: Lean-away dumbbell lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand beside a sturdy support and hold it with your non-working hand.
2. Hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand at your side with palm facing inward, positioning your feet closer to the support so your torso leans away.
3. From this stretched position, raise the dumbbell out to the side until it reaches shoulder height or slightly higher.
4. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one arm, then switch sides.
audio_script: Stand beside a support and hold it with one hand. Lean your torso away from the support while holding a dumbbell at your side. With a bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

name: Cable lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a single-grip handle. Stand sideways to the machine with the working shoulder farthest from the pulley.
2. Grab the handle with the outside hand, palm facing inward, and keep a slight bend in your elbow.
3. Brace your core and keep your torso still as you raise your arm out to the side in a wide arc until it reaches shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handle back to your side under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one arm, then switch sides.
audio_script: Stand sideways to the cable with the pulley low. Hold the handle in the outside hand at your side. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise your arm out to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

name: Leaning forward cable lateral raise
prerequisite_exercise: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
regression: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a single-grip handle. Stand sideways to the machine with the working shoulder farthest from the pulley.
2. Hold the handle with the outside hand, palm facing inward, and step slightly away from the machine.
3. Hinge forward at the hips so your torso leans toward the floor while keeping your back straight and core engaged.
4. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise your arm out to the side in a wide arc until it reaches shoulder height.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Set the pulley low and stand sideways to the machine. Hold the handle in the outside hand and hinge forward at the hips. With a bend in your elbow, raise your arm to shoulder height, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

name: Seated machine lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the lateral raise machine with your back against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Adjust the seat height so the pads rest comfortably against the outside of your upper arms just above the elbows.
2. Grip the handles lightly if available, keeping your torso upright and core braced.
3. Push your arms outward against the pads, raising them in a wide arc until they reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your shoulders.
5. Slowly return the arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the lateral raise machine with the pads against your upper arms. Keep your torso upright and push your arms out to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Barbell front raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep your torso upright, core braced, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise the barbell straight up in front of you until it reaches shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or leaning back.
audio_script: Stand tall with a barbell in front of your thighs, palms down. With elbows slightly bent, raise the bar to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Alternating dumbbell front raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body.
2. Keep your torso upright, core braced, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise one dumbbell straight up in front of you until it reaches shoulder height while keeping the other arm at your side.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position under control as you prepare to lift the opposite arm.
5. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand. Raise one dumbbell to shoulder height, then lower it as you lift the other. Keep your core tight and alternate reps.

name: Seated alternating dumbbell front raise
written_instructions:
1. Sit tall on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward toward your body.
2. Keep your back straight, core engaged, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise one dumbbell forward and upward to shoulder height while rotating your wrist so your palm faces downward at the top.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to your side under control as you prepare to lift the opposite arm.
5. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit tall with dumbbells at your sides, palms in. Raise one dumbbell forward to shoulder height while rotating your wrist so the palm faces down, then lower slowly. Alternate arms for reps.

name: Banded front raise
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and place the middle of the band under one foot in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body, elbows slightly bent, and core engaged.
3. Raise both handles straight forward and upward until they reach shoulder height, keeping arms straight but not locked.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or leaning back.
audio_script: Stand in a staggered stance with the band under one foot and a handle in each hand in front of your thighs. Raise both handles forward to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Handle band front raise
written_instructions:
1. Stand on the middle of a handled resistance band with your feet hip-width apart or in a staggered stance.
2. Hold a handle in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body, elbows slightly bent, and core engaged.
3. Raise both handles straight forward and upward until they reach shoulder height, keeping arms straight but not locked.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, avoiding swinging or leaning back.
audio_script: Stand on the middle of a handled band with a handle in each hand in front of your thighs. Raise both handles forward to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Side lying dumbbell raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your side on a flat bench or the floor, holding a dumbbell in your top hand with your arm extended straight down toward the floor, palm facing your body.
2. Keep your lower arm relaxed along your torso and brace your core.
3. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell upward in an arc until your arm is vertical above your shoulder.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on one side, then switch and perform on the other side.
audio_script: Lie on your side with a dumbbell in the top hand. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise the dumbbell upward until your arm is vertical, then lower slowly. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Lying lateral raise
variations: Standing leaning forward dumbbell lateral raise
written_instructions:
1. Lie face down on a flat or incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms hanging straight down below your shoulders, palms facing each other.
2. Keep your chest supported on the bench, core engaged, and elbows slightly bent.
3. Raise both dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until they reach shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your rear delts.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie face down on a bench with dumbbells hanging below your shoulders. With elbows slightly bent, raise the dumbbells to shoulder height, squeeze, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Cable Y-raise
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a single-grip handle. Stand sideways to the machine with the working shoulder farthest from the pulley.
2. Hold the handle in the outside hand with palm facing inward, arm resting across the front of your body.
3. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise the handle upward and outward at about a 45° angle until your arm forms a “Y” shape with your torso.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your shoulder.
5. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Stand sideways to the cable with the pulley low. Hold the handle in the outside hand and raise it upward and outward at a 45-degree angle into a Y-shape. Pause, then lower slowly. Switch sides.

name: Reverse pec deck
written_instructions:
1. Sit facing the pec deck machine with your chest against the pad, feet flat on the floor, and grasp the handles or place your forearms against the pads.
2. Start with your arms extended forward at shoulder height, elbows slightly bent.
3. Pull the handles or pads outward and backward in a wide arc until your arms are extended to your sides.
4. Pause briefly at the end of the movement, squeezing your rear delts and upper back.
5. Slowly return to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit facing the pec deck with your chest on the pad. Grab the handles and pull your arms back in a wide arc until they’re out to your sides, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Standing barbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell at shoulder level with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of the bar.
3. Press the barbell upward in a slight arc, guiding it forward just enough to avoid your face.
4. At the top, lock out your arms with the barbell directly over the middle of your head.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with a barbell at shoulder height, palms forward. Brace your core and press the bar upward in a slight arc to avoid your face, finishing above the middle of your head. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Seated barbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Sit on a bench with an upright back support and place your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell at shoulder level with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of the bar.
3. Press the barbell upward in a slight arc, guiding it forward just enough to avoid your face.
4. At the top, lock out your arms with the barbell directly over the middle of your head.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit upright with a barbell at shoulder height, palms forward. Brace your core and press the bar upward in a slight arc to avoid your face, finishing above the middle of your head. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: L-sit barbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you in an “L” position, feet together and torso upright. Hold a barbell at shoulder level with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of the bar.
3. Press the barbell upward in a slight arc, guiding it forward just enough to avoid your face.
4. At the top, lock out your arms with the barbell directly above the middle of your head while keeping your torso tall.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the floor with legs straight in front of you and a barbell at shoulder height. Brace your core and press the bar upward in a slight arc to avoid your face, finishing above the middle of your head. Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Standing band shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand on the bottom of a loop band with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the top of the band in each hand.
2. Bring your hands up to shoulder height with palms facing forward, elbows bent, and core braced.
3. Press the band upward in a slight arc until your arms are fully extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep your arms straight but not locked, with the band directly above your head.
5. Slowly lower your hands back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand on a loop band and hold the top in each hand at shoulder height. Press upward until your arms are extended overhead, then lower slowly. Repeat

name: Standing dumbbell shoulder press
variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
progression: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of your torso in a comfortable pressing position.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms forward. Press the dumbbells straight overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
variations: Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder height with your palm facing forward.
2. Place your free hand on your hip or keep it out for balance, brace your core, and keep your torso upright.
3. Press the dumbbell straight upward until your arm is extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbell above your head with your arm straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Stand tall with a dumbbell at shoulder height in one hand. Brace your core and press the dumbbell overhead until your arm is extended, then lower slowly. Repeat and switch sides.

name: Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
regression: Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows close to your sides in a comfortable pressing position.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing each other. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Seated dumbbell shoulder press
variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Sit upright on a bench with a back support, feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows slightly in front of your torso in a comfortable pressing position.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit upright with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms forward. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Seated neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
variations: Standing single arm dumbbell shoulder press
Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
L-sit single arm dumbbell shoulder press
progression: Standing neutral grip dumbbell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Sit upright on a bench with a back support, feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
2. Keep your chest up, core braced, and elbows close to your sides in a comfortable pressing position.
3. Press the dumbbells straight upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the dumbbells above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit upright with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing each other. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Seated shoulder press machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the machine with your back firmly against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Adjust the seat height so the handles are level with or just below your shoulders.
2. Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, palms facing forward, and keep your elbows bent.
3. Brace your core and press the handles upward until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the handles directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to shoulder level under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit with your back against the pad and grasp the handles at shoulder height. Press the handles overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell upright row
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body.
2. Keep your chest up, shoulders down, and core braced.
3. Pull the dumbbells upward along the front of your body by bending your elbows and leading with them, keeping the dumbbells close.
4. Raise the dumbbells until they reach chest level or slightly below shoulder height, keeping elbows higher than wrists.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with dumbbells in front of your thighs, palms in. Lead with your elbows as you pull the dumbbells up to chest level, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Reverse cable crossover
written_instructions:
1. Set both pulleys on a cable machine to the highest setting. Stand in the middle of the machine with your feet staggered for balance.
2. Grab the end of the left cable with your right hand and the end of the right cable with your left hand so the cables cross in front of you. Extend your arms forward at shoulder height with a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Pull the cables outward and backward in a wide arc until your arms are extended straight out to your sides.
4. Pause briefly at the end of the movement, squeezing your rear delts and upper back.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand between two high pulleys and grab the cable ends so they cross in front of you. With elbows slightly bent, pull the cables out and back until your arms are to your sides, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Standing banded high row
variations: Standing rope face pulls with band
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and anchor the band to a sturdy point at shoulder height.
2. Stand facing the anchor in a staggered stance for balance and grasp a handle in each hand, arms extended forward at shoulder height.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest up, and pull the handles back and outward by driving your elbows high and wide.
4. Squeeze your upper back and rear delts at the end of the movement.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand in a staggered stance facing the anchor with the band set at shoulder height. Hold a handle in each hand and pull your elbows back and out wide until your hands reach your upper chest, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Handle band high row
variations: Standing rope face pulls with band
written_instructions:
1. Anchor the handled resistance band to a sturdy point at shoulder height.
2. Stand facing the anchor in a staggered stance and grasp a handle in each hand with arms extended forward at shoulder height.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and pull the handles back and outward by driving your elbows high and wide.
4. Squeeze your upper back and rear delts at the end of the movement.
5. Slowly return your arms to the starting position under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand in a staggered stance facing the anchor with the band set at shoulder height. Hold the handles and pull your elbows back and wide until your hands reach your upper chest, squeeze, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell squat to shoulder press
variations: Double kettlebell squat to shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
2. Brace your core, push your hips back, and lower into a squat until your thighs are about parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels to stand up, using the upward momentum to begin pressing the dumbbells overhead.
4. At the top, extend your arms fully with the dumbbells directly above your head, then lower them back to shoulder height.
5. Flow smoothly into the next squat and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing each other. Squat down, then drive up and press the dumbbells overhead in one motion. Lower them back to your shoulders and repeat.

name: Seated smith machine shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Place a bench with a back support under the Smith machine bar and adjust the bar to about upper-chest level.
2. Sit on the bench with your feet flat on the floor, grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width with palms facing forward, and unrack it to shoulder height.
3. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and press the bar upward along the guided track until your arms are extended overhead.
4. At the top, keep the bar directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on a bench under the Smith bar and unrack it at shoulder height. Press the bar overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Double kettlebell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand in the racked position at shoulder height, palms facing inward and the bells resting against your forearms.
2. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and position your elbows slightly in front of your torso.
3. Press both kettlebells overhead in a smooth motion, allowing your palms to rotate forward naturally as you press.
4. At the top, keep the kettlebells directly above your head with arms straight, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the kettlebells back to the racked position at shoulder height and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hold two kettlebells in the racked position at shoulder height. Brace your core and press them overhead until your arms are extended, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Upside down kettlebell shoulder press
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell upside down in one hand so the round bell is above the handle. Keep it at shoulder height with your palm facing inward and wrist straight.
2. Brace your core, keep your chest tall, and stabilize the kettlebell in the bottoms-up position.
3. Press the kettlebell slowly overhead, keeping it balanced directly above your wrist.
4. At the top, extend your arm fully with the kettlebell directly above your head, avoiding forceful elbow lockout.
5. Slowly lower the kettlebell back to shoulder height under control and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Hold a kettlebell upside down at shoulder height, palm in. Brace your core and press it slowly overhead while keeping it balanced, then lower with control. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: EZ curl bar skull crushers
variations: EZ curl bar floor skull crushers
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding an EZ curl bar with a close overhand grip. Position the bar above your chest with arms extended.
2. Keep your upper arms fixed and elbows pointing upward throughout the movement.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar toward your forehead in a controlled motion.
4. Stop just short of touching your forehead, then press the bar back up by extending your elbows.
5. Fully straighten your arms at the top, avoiding elbow lockout, and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie on a bench holding an EZ curl bar above your chest. Bend your elbows to lower the bar toward your forehead, then extend your arms to press it back up. Repeat.

name: Dumbbell skull crushers
variations: EZ curl bar floor skull crushers
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other.
2. Keep your upper arms fixed and elbows pointing upward throughout the movement.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the dumbbells toward the sides of your head in a controlled motion.
4. Stop just short of touching your head, then extend your elbows to press the dumbbells back up.
5. Fully straighten your arms at the top, avoiding forceful lockout, and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Lie on a bench holding dumbbells above your chest, palms facing each other. Bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells toward your head, then extend your arms to press them back up. Repeat.

name: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
variations: Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
regression: Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ curl bar with a close overhand grip. Press the bar overhead until your arms are fully extended.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and core braced.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then press the bar back up by extending your elbows.
5. Fully extend your arms overhead without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand tall with an EZ curl bar held overhead. Lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows, then press it back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Standing overhead kettlebell triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the round body of a kettlebell with both hands, thumbs placed where the bell meets the handle. Press it overhead until your arms are fully extended.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and brace your core.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the kettlebell behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the kettlebell back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hold the round part of the kettlebell with both hands and press it overhead. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbows, then press it back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
regression: Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand and pressing it overhead until your arm is fully extended.
2. Keep your upper arm close to your head, elbow pointing forward, and core braced.
3. Bend your elbow to slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbow to press the dumbbell back overhead.
5. Complete the desired reps on one arm, then switch sides.
audio_script: Stand tall with a dumbbell held overhead in one hand. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbow, then press it back up until your arm is extended. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
progression: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Sit upright on a bench with back support, feet flat on the floor, holding an EZ curl bar with a close overhand grip. Press the bar overhead until your arms are fully extended.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and core braced against the bench.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the bar back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on a bench holding an EZ curl bar overhead. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbows, then press it back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Seated dumbbell overhead triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Sit upright on a bench with back support, feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Press both dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended, palms facing each other.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and brace your core against the bench.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the dumbbells behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the dumbbells back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forcefully locking out, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on a bench holding two dumbbells overhead, palms facing each other. Lower them behind your head by bending your elbows, then press them back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Seated single arm overhead triceps extension
variations: Standing EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
Seated EZ curl bar Overhead triceps extension
progression: Standing single arm overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Sit upright on a bench with back support, feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in one hand. Press it overhead until your arm is fully extended.
2. Keep your upper arm close to your head, elbow pointing forward, and brace your core against the bench.
3. Bend your elbow to slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbow to press the dumbbell back overhead.
5. Complete the desired reps on one arm, then switch sides.
audio_script: Sit on a bench holding a dumbbell overhead in one hand. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbow, then press it back up until your arm is extended. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Bench dips
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the edge of a sturdy bench with your hands placed next to your hips, fingers pointing forward.
2. Walk your feet forward and extend your legs, keeping your heels on the floor and arms straight to support your weight.
3. Lower your body by bending your elbows straight back until your upper arms are about parallel to the floor.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your body back up.
5. Repeat for the desired reps, keeping your shoulders down and movement controlled.
audio_script: Place your hands on the edge of a bench and extend your legs forward. Lower your body by bending your elbows, then press back up to straight arms. Repeat.

name: Standing dumbbell triceps kickbacks
variations: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
Static bird dog with triceps extension
regression: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
written_instructions:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your body and stand with your feet hip-width apart. Hinge forward slightly at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
2. Bend your elbows to bring the dumbbells to your sides so your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
3. Keeping your upper arms still, extend your elbows to press the dumbbells straight back until your arms are fully extended.
4. Squeeze your triceps briefly at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly bend your elbows to return the dumbbells to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Hinge forward holding dumbbells with elbows bent at your sides. Extend your arms straight back, squeeze your triceps, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Cable triceps kickbacks
variations: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
Static bird dog with triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and stand facing the machine, holding the end of the cable directly in your hand (no attachment).
2. Step back and hinge slightly at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. Bend your elbow to bring your upper arm parallel to the floor, close to your torso.
4. Keeping your upper arm still, extend your elbow to press the cable straight back until your arm is fully extended.
5. Slowly bend your elbow to return to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Hold the end of a low cable and hinge forward slightly. With your elbow by your side, extend your arm straight back, squeeze your triceps, then return slowly. Repeat and switch sides.

name: Single arm dumbbell triceps kickback on bench
variations: Static bird dog with triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Place your left hand and left knee on a flat bench for support, holding a dumbbell in your right hand with your palm facing your body.
2. Keep your back flat, core engaged, and let the dumbbell hang straight down from your shoulder.
3. Bend your right elbow to bring the dumbbell up so your upper arm is parallel to the floor and close to your torso.
4. Keeping your upper arm still, extend your elbow to press the dumbbell straight back until your arm is fully extended.
5. Slowly bend your elbow to return to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Place one hand and knee on a bench for support, holding a dumbbell in the other hand. Bring your elbow up, then extend your arm straight back, squeeze your triceps, and return slowly. Repeat, then switch sides.

name: Seated tricep extension machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the triceps extension machine with your back against the pad and feet flat on the floor. Adjust the seat height so your elbows align with the machine’s pivot point.
2. Grip the handles with your palms facing downward or inward, depending on the machine design.
3. Keep your upper arms close to your head or supported against the pad, elbows bent to start.
4. Press the handles downward by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight.
5. Slowly allow the handles to return to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Sit on the machine with elbows aligned to the pivot. Grip the handles and press them down by extending your elbows, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: V-bar triceps pushdown
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the highest setting and attach a V-bar handle. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grip the V-bar with both hands using a neutral grip (palms facing inward) and bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.
4. Press the V-bar down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, keeping elbows tucked in.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley with a V-bar. Keep your elbows close and press the bar down until your arms are straight, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Curl bar triceps pushdown
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the highest setting and attach an EZ-curl bar. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grip the bar on the angled portions with palms facing slightly inward and bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.
4. Press the bar down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, keeping elbows tucked in.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley with an EZ-curl bar. Keep your elbows close and press the bar down until your arms are straight, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Curl bar overhead triceps extension
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach an EZ-curl bar. Stand facing away from the machine and grasp the bar on the angled portions with palms facing slightly inward. Step forward so the cable runs behind your head and press the bar overhead until your arms are extended.
2. Keep your upper arms close to your head, elbows pointing forward, and brace your core.
3. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar behind your head in a controlled arc.
4. Stop when you feel a stretch in your triceps, then extend your elbows to press the bar back overhead.
5. Fully extend your arms without forceful lockout, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing away from a low cable with an EZ-curl bar. Hold it overhead with elbows close to your head. Lower it behind your head by bending your elbows, then press back up until your arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Rope triceps pushdown
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the highest setting and attach a rope handle. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grab one end of the rope in each hand with palms facing each other and bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.
4. Press the rope down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, separating the rope ends at the bottom.
5. Slowly return the rope to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley with a rope. Keep your elbows close, press the rope down, and separate the ends at the bottom. Return slowly and repeat.

name: Rope overhead triceps pushdown
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the lowest setting and attach a rope handle. Stand facing away from the machine, step forward so the cable runs behind your head, and hold one end of the rope in each hand with palms facing each other.
2. Bring the rope overhead so your elbows are bent and close to your head, core braced.
3. Extend your elbows to press the rope forward and upward until your arms are fully straight.
4. Separate the rope ends slightly at the end of the movement and squeeze your triceps.
5. Slowly return the rope to the starting position behind your head under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Face away from a low cable with a rope. Hold it overhead with elbows close to your head. Extend your arms forward and up, separating the rope ends slightly at the finish, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Straight bar underhand tricep pushdown
written_instructions:
1. Set a cable pulley to the highest setting and attach a straight bar. Stand facing the machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grasp the bar with an underhand (supinated) grip—palms facing up—hands about shoulder-width apart. Bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.
4. Press the bar down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, keeping your elbows tucked in.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Stand facing a high pulley holding a straight bar palms up. Keep elbows close and press the bar down until your arms are straight, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Overhand triceps pushdown with loop band
variations: Underhand triceps pushdown with loop band
Horizontal triceps extension with loop band
progression: Overhand triceps pushdown with loop band
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of one loop band and anchor the middle of the band to a sturdy point at about head height. Stand facing the anchor with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with an overhand (pronated) grip — palms facing down — and bring your elbows close to your torso.
3. Start with your elbows bent at about 90 degrees, forearms pointing forward and down.
4. Press the handles down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully straight, keeping elbows tucked in.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Anchor one loop band with two handles at head height. Hold the handles palms down, elbows close, and press down until your arms are straight, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Horizontal triceps extension with loop band
variations: Underhand triceps pushdown with loop band
Overhand triceps pushdown with loop band
regression: Overhand triceps pushdown with loop band
written_instructions:
1. Attach a single-grip handle to each end of a loop band and anchor the middle at about chest height. Stand facing away from the anchor with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing away from your body (pronated grip), elbows bent at 90 degrees, and upper arms parallel to the floor. Bring the handles next to your ears.
3. Keep your elbows tucked in and stationary, maintaining the 90-degree angle between your upper arms and torso.
4. Extend your arms fully in front of you until straight, keeping control and tension in the triceps.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position next to your ears, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Anchor a loop band at chest height. Hold a handle in each hand palms away from you, elbows bent and upper arms parallel to the floor, handles next to your ears. Extend your arms fully in front, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Horizontal triceps extension with Handle band
variations: Underhand triceps pushdown with Handle band
Overhand triceps pushdown with Handle band
regression: Overhand triceps pushdown with Handle band
written_instructions:
1. Anchor the handle band to a sturdy point at about chest height. Stand facing away from the anchor with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold a handle in each hand with palms facing away from your body (pronated grip), elbows bent at 90 degrees, and upper arms parallel to the floor. Bring the handles next to your ears.
3. Keep your elbows tucked in and stationary, maintaining the 90-degree angle between your upper arms and torso.
4. Extend your arms fully in front of you until straight, keeping control and tension in the triceps.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position next to your ears, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Anchor the handle band at chest height. Hold a handle in each hand palms away from you, elbows bent and upper arms parallel to the floor, handles next to your ears. Extend your arms fully in front, then return slowly. Repeat.

name: Diamond push up
written_instructions:
1. Start in a standard push-up position with your hands together under your chest, forming a diamond shape by touching your thumbs and index fingers.
2. Position your feet hip-width apart and keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Engage your core and glutes to maintain alignment throughout the movement.
4. Lower your chest toward your hands by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your torso.
5. Push back up to the starting position by straightening your arms, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Start in a push-up position with your hands forming a diamond under your chest. Keep your body straight, elbows close, and lower your chest toward your hands. Push back up slowly and repeat.

name: Assisted wide grip pull up
written_instructions:
1. Adjust the assisted pull-up machine to the desired assistance level. Selecting a heavier weight from the stack increases assistance, making the exercise easier. Kneel or stand on the foot platform as instructed.
2. Grip the pull-up bar with hands wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing away from you (pronated grip).
3. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
4. Pull your chest up toward the bar by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Set the assisted pull-up machine to your level — heavier stack weight gives more assistance and makes it easier. Grip the bar wider than shoulders, palms away. Pull your chest up, squeeze shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Banded wide grip pull up
written_instructions:
1. Secure a resistance band around a pull-up bar and place your knee or foot in the band to assist the movement.
2. Grip the bar with hands wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing away (pronated grip).
3. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
4. Pull your chest up toward the bar by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together, using the band for assistance.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Place a resistance band around the pull-up bar and step or kneel in it for assistance. Grip the bar wide, palms away. Pull your chest up, squeezing your shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Wide grip pull up
written_instructions:
1. Grip a pull-up bar with hands wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing away from you (pronated grip).
2. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
3. Keep your body stable without swinging or kipping.
4. Pull your chest up toward the bar by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Grip the bar wide, palms away. Hang with shoulders engaged and core tight. Pull your chest up to the bar, squeeze shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Assisted neutral grip pull up
written_instructions:
1. Adjust the assisted pull-up machine to the desired assistance level. Selecting a heavier weight increases assistance, making the exercise easier. Kneel or stand on the foot platform as instructed.
2. Grip the pull-up handles with palms facing each other (neutral grip).
3. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
4. Pull your chest toward the handles by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Set the assisted machine to your level — heavier stack weight gives more assistance. Grip the handles with palms facing each other. Pull your chest to the handles, squeezing shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Neutral grip pull up
written_instructions:
1. Grip the pull-up bar with palms facing each other (neutral grip) at roughly shoulder-width apart.
2. Hang fully extended with shoulders engaged, chest up, and core tight.
3. Keep your body stable without swinging or kipping.
4. Pull your chest toward the bar by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position under control, then repeat for the desired reps.
audio_script: Grip the bar with palms facing each other, shoulder-width apart. Hang with shoulders engaged and core tight. Pull your chest to the bar, squeeze your shoulder blades, then lower slowly. Repeat.

name: Assisted chin ups
written_instructions:
1. Adjust the assisted pull-up/chin-up machine to the desired assistance level. Note: selecting a heavier weight increases assistance, making the exercise easier. Kneel or stand on the foot platform as instructed.
2. Grip the handles or bar with palms facing you (supinated grip), hands about shoulder-width apart.
