4. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position.
5. Step backward with the other leg and repeat, continuing to alternate legs for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Rest a barbell across your upper back. Step backward with one leg and bend both knees to lower into a lunge, keeping the front thigh parallel and knee over ankle. Push through the front foot to return to start, then step back with the other leg and continue alternating for reps.

name: Bodyweight lateral lunges
variations: Double front rack kettlebell lateral lunges
Single arm front rack kettlebell lateral lunge
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Step out to the side with one leg, keeping the other leg straight.
3. Bend the knee of the stepping leg and push your hips back while lowering your body toward that side. Keep the stepping knee roughly over the ankle and pointing in the same direction as your toes.
4. Push through the foot of the bent leg to return to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on that side before switching to the other leg.
audio_script: Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart. Step out to the side with one leg and bend that knee while keeping the other leg straight. Push hips back and lower down, keeping the stepping knee over the ankle. Push through the foot to return to start. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

name: Dumbbell lateral lunges
variations: Double front rack kettlebell lateral lunges
Single arm front rack kettlebell lateral lunge
written_instructions:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing your body.
2. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Step out to the side with one leg, keeping the other leg straight.
4. Bend the knee of the stepping leg and push your hips back while lowering your body toward that side. Keep the stepping knee roughly over the ankle and pointing in the same direction as your toes.
5. Push through the foot of the bent leg to return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps on that side before switching legs.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Step out to the side with one leg and bend that knee while keeping the other leg straight. Push hips back and lower down, keeping the stepping knee over the ankle. Push through the foot to return to start. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

name: Goblet lateral lunges
variations: Double front rack kettlebell lateral lunges
Single arm front rack kettlebell lateral lunge
written_instructions:
1. Hold a dumbbell close to your chest in a goblet position with both hands.
2. Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Step out to the side with one leg, keeping the other leg straight.
4. Bend the knee of the stepping leg and push your hips back while lowering your body toward that side. Keep the stepping knee roughly over the ankle and pointing in the same direction as your toes.
5. Push through the foot of the bent leg to return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps on that side before switching legs.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell close to your chest in a goblet position. Step out to the side with one leg and bend that knee while keeping the other leg straight. Push hips back and lower down, keeping the stepping knee over the ankle. Push through the foot to return to start. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

name: Glute bridge with abduction
variations: Single leg glute bridge with abduction
written_instructions:
1. Place a mini loop band just above your knees. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Arms should rest at your sides.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. At the top, push your knees outward against the band to perform hip abduction, then return knees to hip-width distance.
5. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor and repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Place a mini loop band just above your knees. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Engage your core and glutes, lift your hips to form a straight line from shoulders to knees, and push your knees outward against the band. Lower back down and repeat for reps.

name: Bodyweight hip thrust
variations: Single leg hip thrust with abduction
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the floor with your upper back resting against a bench or elevated surface, knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands on your hips or lightly behind your neck, whichever feels comfortable.
3. Engage your core and glutes.
4. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, keeping your knees roughly above your ankles.
5. Slowly lower your hips back down and repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit on the floor with your upper back against a bench, knees bent and feet flat. Place your hands on your hips or lightly behind your neck. Engage your core and glutes, press through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, keeping knees above ankles. Lower back down and repeat for reps.

name: Barbell hip thrust
variations: Single leg hip thrust with abduction
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the floor with your upper back resting against a bench or elevated surface, knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
2. Roll a barbell over your legs and position it across your hips. You can hold the barbell with hands for stability or use a pad for comfort.
3. Engage your core and glutes.
4. Press through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees, keeping your knees roughly above your ankles.
5. Slowly lower your hips back down and repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit on the floor with your upper back against a bench, knees bent and feet flat. Place a barbell across your hips, using your hands or a pad for comfort. Engage your core and glutes, lift your hips to form a straight line from shoulders to knees, keeping knees above ankles. Lower back down and repeat for reps.

name: Single leg elevated hip thrusts
variations: Single leg elevated hip thrusts tricep extension
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with one heel resting on an elevated surface (e.g., bench or step) and the other leg extended straight. The bent leg’s knee should be at roughly 90 degrees, hip-width apart. Arms should rest at your sides for support.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Press through the heel of the bent leg to lift your hips toward the ceiling, forming a straight line from shoulders to extended foot.
4. Hold the top position briefly, squeezing your glutes and hamstrings.
5. Slowly lower your hips back down and repeat for the desired number of reps on that leg before switching sides.
audio_script: Lie on the floor with one heel on an elevated surface and the other leg extended. Keep the bent leg’s knee at roughly 90 degrees. Engage your core and glutes, lift your hips through the bent leg until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to extended foot. Hold, then lower back down and repeat for reps, then switch legs.

name: Deadlift
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, toes pointing forward or slightly outward. Place a barbell on the floor in front of your shins.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend your knees to grip the barbell with hands just outside your knees, using either a double overhand or mixed grip. Keep your back flat and chest up.
3. Engage your core, pull your shoulder blades back, and maintain a neutral spine.
4. Drive through your heels, extend your hips and knees simultaneously to lift the barbell along your legs until standing fully upright.
5. Lower the barbell under control by hinging at the hips and bending your knees, keeping the bar close to your body, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet hip-width apart and barbell in front. Hinge at the hips and bend your knees to grip the bar, back flat and chest up. Engage your core, lift the bar by extending hips and knees, then lower it along your legs under control. Repeat for reps.

name: Sumo deadlift
written_instructions:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed outward. Position a barbell on the floor over your mid-foot.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend your knees to grip the bar with hands inside your legs, using an overhand grip. Keep your chest up and back flat.
3. Engage your core, pull your shoulder blades back, and maintain a neutral spine.
4. Drive through your heels, extend your hips and knees simultaneously to lift the barbell until standing fully upright.
5. Lower the barbell under control by hinging at the hips and bending your knees, keeping the bar close to your body, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width, toes slightly out, barbell over mid-foot. Grip the bar with hands inside your legs, back flat and chest up. Engage your core, lift the bar by extending hips and knees, then lower under control. Repeat for reps.

name: Dumbbell romanian deadlift (RDL)
written_instructions:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs, palms facing your legs. Stand upright with feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Slightly bend your knees and hinge at the hips to lower the dumbbells along the front of your legs. Keep your chest up and back flat.
4. Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, usually just below the knees.
5. Drive your hips forward to return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs, palms facing your legs. Stand with feet hip-width apart, core engaged, back neutral. Slightly bend your knees and hinge at the hips to lower the dumbbells along your legs until you feel a hamstring stretch. Drive your hips forward to stand and squeeze your glutes. Repeat for reps.

name: Barbell romanian deadlift (RDL)
written_instructions:
1. Hold a barbell in front of your thighs with a pronated grip (palms facing your legs). Stand upright with feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Slightly bend your knees and hinge at the hips to lower the barbell along the front of your legs. Keep your chest up and back flat.
4. Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, usually just below the knees.
5. Drive your hips forward to return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top, then repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Hold a barbell in front of your thighs, palms facing your legs. Stand with feet hip-width apart, core engaged, back neutral. Slightly bend your knees and hinge at the hips to lower the bar along your legs until you feel a hamstring stretch. Drive your hips forward to stand and squeeze your glutes. Repeat for reps.

name: Bodyweight single leg romanian deadlift (RDL)
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright on one leg with the other leg slightly bent behind you. Keep your standing foot hip-width apart for balance.
2. Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Hinge at the hips, lowering your torso forward while extending the non-standing leg straight behind you. Keep your back flat and arms extended toward the floor or in front of you for balance.
4. Lower until you feel a stretch in the hamstring of the standing leg.
5. Drive your hips forward to return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top, then repeat for the desired number of reps before switching legs.
audio_script: Stand on one leg with the other leg extended behind you. Engage your core, hinge at the hips to lower your torso while keeping the back flat and arms extended forward. Feel the stretch in the standing leg’s hamstring, then return to standing and squeeze your glutes. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

name: Dumbbell single leg romanian deadlift (RDL)
written_instructions:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs, palms facing your legs. Stand on one leg with the other leg slightly bent behind you.
2. Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Hinge at the hips, lowering the dumbbells along the front of your standing leg while extending the non-standing leg straight behind you. Keep your back flat.
4. Lower until you feel a stretch in the hamstring of the standing leg.
5. Drive your hips forward to return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top, then repeat for the desired number of reps before switching legs.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs, palms facing your legs. Stand on one leg with the other extended behind you. Engage your core, hinge at the hips, and lower the dumbbells along the front of the standing leg. Feel the hamstring stretch, then return to standing and squeeze your glutes. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

name: Step ups
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright facing a sturdy platform or bench, feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your chest up.
3. Step onto the platform with one foot, pressing through the heel to lift your body up until your standing leg is fully extended.
4. Slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps on the working leg before switching sides.
audio_script: Stand facing a sturdy platform, feet hip-width apart. Step onto the platform with one foot, pressing through the heel to lift your body. Slowly lower back down. Repeat for reps on that side, then switch legs.

name: Step ups with glute kickback
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright facing a sturdy platform or bench, feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your chest up.
3. Step onto the platform with one foot, pressing through the heel to lift your body up until your standing leg is fully extended.
4. At the top, extend the non-working leg straight back and upward, performing a glute kickback.
5. Lower the non-working leg and your body back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps on the working leg before switching sides.
audio_script: Stand facing a sturdy platform. Step up with one foot, pressing through the heel to lift your body. At the top, extend the other leg back and up for a glute kickback, then lower back down. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

name: 45-degree leg press machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the 45-degree leg press machine with your back and head against the pad, feet flat on the platform hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands on the handles for support.
3. Engage your core and press through your heels to extend your legs, fully straightening your knees without locking them.
4. Slowly bend your knees to lower the platform toward your body under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit on the machine with back against the pad, feet flat on the platform. Press through your heels to extend your legs, then slowly bend your knees to lower the platform. Repeat for reps.

name: Hack squat
written_instructions:
1. Stand on the hack squat machine with your back against the pad, feet hip-width apart on the platform.
2. Place your shoulders under the shoulder pads and engage your core.
3. Bend your knees and hips to lower your body until your thighs are roughly parallel to the platform.
4. Press through your heels to extend your knees and hips, returning to the starting position.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Stand on the machine with back against the pad, shoulders under pads. Bend knees and hips to lower until thighs are roughly parallel, then press through your heels to return to start. Repeat for reps.

name: Side-lying hip abduction
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your side with your legs extended straight and stacked on top of each other. Rest your head on your bottom arm, and place your top hand on your hip for support.
2. Engage your core and keep your hips stacked.
3. Lift the top leg upward as high as comfortably possible, keeping it straight.
4. Pause at the top and squeeze your glutes.
5. Slowly lower the leg back down and repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Lie on your side with legs stacked. Lift the top leg upward, squeeze glutes at the top, then lower. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

name: Clamshells
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent at roughly 90 degrees and legs stacked. Rest your head on your bottom arm and place your top hand on your hip.
2. Engage your core and keep your hips stacked.
3. Lift your top knee as high as comfortably possible while keeping your feet together.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing your glutes.
5. Slowly lower your knee back down and repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Lie on your side with knees bent, feet together. Lift the top knee while keeping feet together, squeeze glutes, then lower. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

name: Standing banded hip abduction
written_instructions:
1. Place a mini loop band just above your knees. Stand upright next to a wall or support, feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Push one leg outward against the resistance of the band, lifting it as high as comfortably possible.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing your glutes.
5. Slowly return the leg to the starting position and repeat for reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Stand with a mini loop band above your knees. Push one leg outward against the band, squeeze glutes, then return. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

name: Seated abduction machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the abduction machine with your back against the pad and feet on the platform. Adjust the pads to rest against the outside of your knees or thighs.
2. Engage your core and keep your chest upright.
3. Push outward against the pads to spread your legs apart.
4. Pause at the end of the movement, squeezing your glutes.
5. Slowly return your legs to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit on the machine with back against the pad, feet on the platform. Push outward against the pads, squeeze glutes, then return. Repeat for reps.

name: Bodyweight glute kickback
written_instructions:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Engage your core.
3. Extend one leg straight back and upward, keeping the knee slightly bent or straight.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing your glutes.
5. Lower the leg under control and repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Start on all fours. Extend one leg straight back and up, squeeze glutes at the top, then lower. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

name: Banded glute kickback
written_instructions:
1. Place a mini loop band around your thighs just above your knees. Start on all fours, hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Engage your core.
3. Extend one leg back and upward against the resistance of the band, keeping the knee slightly bent or straight.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing your glutes.
5. Slowly return the leg to the starting position and repeat for reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Start on all fours with a mini loop band above your knees. Extend one leg back against the band, squeeze glutes, then return. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

name: Standing banded glute kickback
written_instructions:
1. Place a mini loop band around your thighs just above your knees. Stand upright holding onto a support for balance, feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Extend one leg backward against the resistance of the band while keeping your knee slightly bent.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing your glutes.
5. Slowly return the leg to the starting position and repeat for reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Stand with a mini loop band above your knees, holding support. Extend one leg back against the band, squeeze glutes, then return. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

name: Standing cable glute kickback
written_instructions:
1. Attach an ankle strap to a low cable pulley and secure it around one ankle. Stand upright next to the cable machine for support, feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Extend the strapped leg backward against the cable’s resistance, keeping the knee slightly bent.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing your glutes.
5. Slowly return the leg to the starting position and repeat for reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Attach an ankle strap to a low cable pulley. Extend the strapped leg backward against resistance, squeeze glutes, then return. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

name: Lying down plated hamstring curl machine
variations: Single leg lying down banded hamstring curl
Single leg lying down cable hamstring curl
written_instructions:
1. Lie face down on the hamstring curl machine and place your ankles under the padded lever.
2. Engage your core and keep your hips pressed against the bench.
3. Bend your knees to curl the lever toward your glutes.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing your hamstrings.
5. Slowly lower the lever back to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie face down on the machine with ankles under the pad. Bend your knees to curl the lever toward your glutes, squeeze, then lower. Repeat for reps.

name: Quad extension machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the leg extension machine with your back against the pad and feet under the padded lever, knee joint aligned with the machine pivot.
2. Engage your core and hold the handles for support.
3. Extend your knees to lift the lever until your legs are straight.
4. Slowly lower the lever back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Sit with knees aligned to the machine pivot, feet under the pad. Extend your knees to lift the lever, then lower slowly under control. Repeat for reps.

name: Single leg quad extension machine
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the leg extension machine with your back against the pad and one foot under the padded lever, knee joint aligned with the machine pivot.
2. Engage your core and hold the handles for support.
3. Extend the knee of the working leg to lift the lever until your leg is straight.
4. Slowly lower the lever back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching legs.
audio_script: Sit with one foot under the pad, knee aligned with the machine pivot. Extend the working knee to lift the lever, then lower slowly under control. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

name: Standing bodyweight calf extensions
variations: Standing single leg calf extensions with 2 Dumbbell
Single leg seated dumbbell calf extensions
written_instructions:
1. Stand upright on the edge of an elevated surface (e.g., step or block) with the balls of your feet on the edge, heels hanging off. Optionally hold a wall or support for balance.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Raise your heels as high as comfortably possible.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing your calves.
5. Slowly lower your heels below the level of the platform to feel a stretch, then repeat for reps.
audio_script: Stand on the edge of a step with heels hanging off. Raise your heels as high as possible, squeeze calves, then lower below the step for a stretch. Repeat for reps.

name: Standing single leg calf extensions
variations: Standing single leg calf extensions with 2 Dumbbell
Single leg seated dumbbell calf extensions
progression: Standing single leg calf extensions with 2 Dumbbell
written_instructions:
1. Stand on one foot on the edge of an elevated surface, balls of the foot on the edge, heel hanging off. Use a wall or support for balance.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Raise your heel as high as comfortably possible.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing the calf.
5. Slowly lower the heel below the platform level for a stretch, then repeat for reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Stand on one foot on a step, heel hanging off. Raise the heel, squeeze calf, then lower below step for a stretch. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

name: Standing single leg calf extensions with 2 Dumbbell
variations: Single leg seated dumbbell calf extensions
written_instructions:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. 
2. Stand on one foot, engage your core, and keep your torso upright.
3. Raise your heel off the ground, pushing through the ball of the foot to lift as high as comfortably possible.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing the calf.
5. Slowly lower the heel and repeat for reps before switching sides.
audio_script: Hold a dumbbell in each hand. Stand on one foot, raise your heel, squeeze the calf, then lower. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

name: Standing plated calf machine
variations: Standing single leg calf extensions with 2 Dumbbell
Single leg seated dumbbell calf extensions
written_instructions:
1. Position yourself on the standing calf raise machine with the balls of your feet on the platform and heels hanging off.
2. Rest your shoulders under the pads and engage your core.
3. Press through the balls of your feet to raise your heels as high as possible.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing your calves.
5. Slowly lower your heels below platform level to stretch the calves, then repeat for reps.
audio_script: Stand on the machine with balls of your feet on the platform, heels hanging off. Raise heels as high as possible, squeeze calves, then lower below platform for a stretch. Repeat for reps.

name: Seated plated calf machine
variations: Standing single leg calf extensions with 2 Dumbbell
Single leg seated dumbbell calf extensions
written_instructions:
1. Sit on the seated calf raise machine with the balls of your feet on the platform and heels hanging off, and pads resting on your thighs.
2. Engage your core and keep your back straight.
3. Press through the balls of your feet to lift your heels as high as possible.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing your calves.
5. Slowly lower your heels below platform level for a stretch, then repeat for reps.
audio_script: Sit on the machine with balls of your feet on the platform, heels hanging off. Press up through the balls of your feet, squeeze calves, then lower below platform for a stretch. Repeat for reps.

name: Seated dumbbell calf extensions
variations: Standing single leg calf extensions with 2 Dumbbell
Single leg seated dumbbell calf extensions
written_instructions:
1. Sit on a bench with dumbbells placed on thighs, balls of the feet on an elevated surface and heels hanging off.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Press through the balls of your feet to raise your heels as high as possible.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing your calves.
5. Slowly lower your heels below the surface for a stretch, then repeat for reps.
audio_script: Sit on a bench with dumbbells on your thighs, balls of your feet on a step. Raise your heels as high as possible, squeeze calves, then lower below step. Repeat for reps.

name: Single leg seated dumbbell calf extensions
variations: Standing single leg calf extensions with 2 Dumbbell
written_instructions:
1. Sit on a bench with a dumbbell on the working thigh, balls of one foot on an elevated surface and heel hanging off.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Press through the ball of the foot to raise your heel as high as possible.
4. Pause at the top, squeezing the calf.
5. Slowly lower the heel below the surface for a stretch, then repeat for reps before switching legs.
audio_script: Sit on a bench with a dumbbell on one thigh, ball of the foot on a step. Raise the heel, squeeze calf, then lower below step. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

name: Dynamic lower back extension
written_instructions:
1. Lie face down on a back extension bench with hips at the pad’s edge and feet secured.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Lift your torso upward while keeping a neutral spine.
4. Slowly lower your torso back down under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie face down on a back extension bench. Lift your torso, keeping a neutral spine, then lower under control. Repeat for reps.

name: Weighted dynamic lower back extension
written_instructions:
1. Lie face down on a back extension bench with hips at the pad’s edge and feet secured. Hold a weight plate or dumbbell against your chest.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Lift your torso upward while keeping a neutral spine.
4. Slowly lower the torso back down under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie face down on a back extension bench with a weight on your chest. Lift your torso, keeping spine neutral, then lower under control. Repeat for reps.

name: Deadbug
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with arms extended toward the ceiling and knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Slowly lower one arm and the opposite leg toward the floor without letting your lower back arch.
4. Return the arm and leg to the starting position.
5. Repeat on the other side and continue alternating for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie on the floor with arms up, knees at 90 degrees. Lower one arm and opposite leg without arching the back, return, and alternate for reps.

name: Single straight leg raise
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with one leg extended on the ground and the other leg straight up toward the ceiling.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Slowly lower the raised leg toward the floor without letting your lower back arch.
4. Pause briefly just above the floor.
5. Raise the leg back to the starting position and repeat for reps before switching legs.
audio_script: Lie on your back with one leg on the floor and the other straight up. Lower the raised leg slowly without arching your back, then lift back up. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.

name: Plank
written_instructions:
1. Start on the floor in a forearm plank position with elbows under shoulders and feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core and glutes, keeping your spine neutral.
3. Maintain a straight line from head to heels.
4. Hold this position for the desired duration.
5. Slowly release and rest before repeating if performing multiple holds.
audio_script: Hold a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and feet hip-width apart. Engage core and glutes, keep a straight line from head to heels.

name: Side plank
written_instructions:
1. Start on your side with your forearm on the ground under your shoulder and legs extended straight, stacked on top of each other.
2. Engage your core and glutes.
3. Lift your hips off the ground to form a straight line from head to feet.
4. Hold this position for the desired duration.
5. Slowly lower your hips and repeat for the other side.
audio_script: Lie on your side with forearm on the ground and legs straight. Lift your hips to form a straight line from head to feet, engage core and glutes, hold, then switch sides.

name: Weighted side plank
written_instructions:
1. Start in a side plank position on your forearm, legs extended and stacked, with your top hand holding a dumbbell on your hip.
2. Engage your core and glutes, keeping your spine neutral.
3. Lift your hips off the ground to form a straight line from head to feet.
4. Hold this position for the desired duration.
5. Slowly lower your hips and repeat for the other side.
audio_script: Hold a side plank on your forearm with legs stacked, top hand holding a dumbbell on your hip. Lift hips to form a straight line, hold, then lower. Repeat on the other side.

name: Hanging knees-bent leg raise
variations: Lying leg raises with band abduction
Lying leg raises with stability ball
Lying leg raises with kettlebell pullover
written_instructions:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, arms fully extended, and feet together.
2. Engage your core and keep your spine neutral.
3. Lift your knees toward your chest while keeping them bent.
4. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position under control.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Hang from a pull-up bar. Lift your knees toward your chest, then lower slowly. Repeat for reps.

name: Hanging straight-leg leg raise
variations: Lying leg raises with band abduction
Lying leg raises with stability ball
Lying leg raises with kettlebell pullover
written_instructions:
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, arms fully extended, and feet together.
2. Engage your core and keep your spine neutral.
3. Lift your legs straight in front of you toward the ceiling.
4. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position under control without swinging.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Hang from a pull-up bar. Lift your legs straight in front of you, lower slowly without swinging, and repeat for reps.

name: Crunches
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, arms crossed over your chest or hands behind your head.
2. Engage your core.
3. Curl your shoulders and upper back off the floor, keeping your lower back pressed.
4. Pause briefly at the top.
5. Slowly lower back to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie on your back with knees bent. Curl your shoulders off the floor, pause briefly, then lower back down. Repeat for reps.

name: Weighted Crunches
written_instructions:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Hold a weight plate or dumbbell against your chest or extended above your chest.
2. Engage your core.
3. Curl your shoulders and upper back off the floor, keeping your lower back pressed.
4. Pause briefly at the top, squeezing your abdominals.
5. Slowly lower back to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.
audio_script: Lie on your back holding a weight against or above your chest. Curl shoulders off the floor, squeeze abs at the top, then lower slowly. Repeat for reps.

name: Mountain climbers
written_instructions:
1. Start in a high plank position with hands under shoulders and feet together.
2. Engage your core and keep your spine neutral.
3. Drive one knee toward your chest, then quickly switch legs in a running-like motion.
4. Continue alternating legs at a controlled but consistent pace.
5. Repeat for the desired number duration.
audio_script: Start in a plank position. Drive one knee toward your chest, then switch legs quickly, alternating for duration.

name: Dynamic pallof press with cable
written_instructions:
1. Stand perpendicular to a cable machine with the handle held at chest level, arms bent, and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Press the handle straight out in front of you and slowly bring it back toward your chest.
4. Perform this pressing motion dynamically while resisting rotation.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides.
audio_script: Stand perpendicular to a cable, hold the handle at chest. Press it straight out and back dynamically while resisting rotation. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

name: Dynamic pallof press with band
written_instructions:
1. Attach a handle to a loop band anchored at chest height. Stand perpendicular to the anchor, holding the handle at chest level with arms bent and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Engage your core and keep your torso upright.
3. Press the handle straight out in front of you and then back toward your chest dynamically, resisting rotation.
4. Maintain control throughout the movement.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides.
audio_script: Stand perpendicular to a loop band anchored at chest height, holding the handle at chest. Press out and back dynamically while resisting rotation. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.
